summary: State-reported data helps the federal government oversee the Medicaid program. Our prior work found issues with the completeness and accuracy of the data in the federal repository and made recommendations. Since then, federal Medicaid administrators have improved that data. For example, we found that all states provided at least some data in nearly all of the Medicaid-related topic areas, and that the data was generally...
title: Medicaid: Data Completeness and Accuracy Have Improved, Though Not All Standards Have Been Met
